text: Henry Calvin Johnson Jr.Marriages, The Atlanta Constitution, January 24, 1980 (born October 2, 1954) is an American lawyer and politician. He is the U.S. representative for since 2007. He is a member of the Democratic Party. Johnson is one of only three Buddhists to have been in the United States Congress. The others are Senator Mazie Hirono and former Representative Colleen Hanabusa, both of Hawaii. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Georgia Category:Politicians from Washington, D.C. title: Hank Johnson
